quizlist.question: When a megohmmeter is being used to test insulation resistance, current leakage along the surface of the insulation is indicated by the megohmmeter's pointer ______ .?
quizlist.option1: kicking slightly down scale as voltage is applied
quizlist.option2: fluctuating around a constant resistance reading
quizlist.option3: dipping toward zero then raising slowly

quizlist.question: The charge of a lead-acid battery can be restored by________.?
quizlist.option1: passing a direct electric current through the cell
quizlist.option2: passing an alternating electric current through the cell

quizlist.question: The division of kilowatt load between two paralleled alternators is determined by the______ .?
quizlist.option1: load-speed characteristics of the governors
quizlist.option2: high-speed characteristics of the governors

quizlist.question: When a flourescent lamp has reached the end of its useful life, it should be replaced immediately, or the resultant flashing may____.
quizlist.option1: Damage the starter and the ballast
quizlist.option2: Damage the connection and the ballast
quizlist.option3: Damage the flourescent lamp and the ballast

quizlist.question: Which of the following precautions should you take when securing propulsion generators and motors for an extended period of time?
quizlist.option1: Lift the brushes from commutator collector rings and use the built-in heater to prevent moisture accumulation
quizlist.option2: Lift the brushes from commutator collector rings and  circulate cool dry air through the units
quizlist.option3: Disconnect the brush pigtails from their contacts and  circulate air through the units.

quizlist.question: Third color band on a resistor is used to indicate the_______.?
quizlist.option1: number of zeros following the first two significant figures in the resistance value
quizlist.option2: tolerance of the resistor
quizlist.option3: first significant figure of the resistance

quizlist.question: To protect the fuse from getting damaged during removal from a fuse holder, it is detached with the aid of a ____________.?
quizlist.option1: Fuse puller tool
quizlist.option2: gear puller tool

quizlist.question: On AC vessels, which of the following statements represents the most difficult problem involved in obtaining a DC potential suitable for use by computer components?
quizlist.option1: the voltage must be rectified and made ripple free
quizlist.option2: the voltage are free to flow

quizlist.question: When soldering a printed circuit board component, you should be careful to prevent circuit and board damage for what reason?
quizlist.option1: Using soldering iron heat sparingly
quizlist.option2: Using soldering iron can re-heat sparingly
quizlist.option3: Using soldering iron can joint to wires

quizlist.question: Most three-phase induction motors of five (5) horsepower or less, are started by_______.?
quizlist.option1: across-the-line starters
quizlist.option2: reactor starters

quizlist.question: A full-wave rectifier has one diode burned out in an open condition, what will be the output characteristic of the device?
quizlist.option1: Half-wave rectified
quizlist.option2: Zero

quizlist.question: When a megohmmeter is being used to test insulation resistance, current leakage along the surface of the insulation is indicated by the megohmmeter's pointer ______ .?
quizlist.option1: kicking slightly down scale as voltage is applied
quizlist.option2: fluctuating around a constant resistance reading
quizlist.option3: dipping toward zero then raising slowly

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting an electronic circuit, a cold solder joint can be located with the aid of an ohmmeter. Once the problem has been located, you should______.?
quizlist.option1: reheat connection with a soldering tool and recheck with an ohmmeter
quizlist.option2: do nothing as this is the normal condition
quizlist.option3: reheat the circuit in an oven to an even temperature and recheck with an ohmmeter

quizlist.question: In an impressed current cathodic protection system, the anode is_______?
quizlist.option1: insulated from the hull and does not waste away.
quizlist.option2: connected to the hull and deteriorates with time
quizlist.option3: connected to the hull but does not waste away

quizlist.question: For maintenance of non-sealed batteries, the statements below are TRUE except ____________.?
quizlist.option1: It should be placed in a tightly closed compartment
quizlist.option2: It should be placed in a loosen closed compartment
quizlist.option3: It should be placed in a closed compartment

quizlist.question: A molded-case breaker provides protection against short circuits by using a/an_______.?
quizlist.option1: electromagnet
quizlist.option2: shading coil

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting electronic equipment, the first step to be taken before testing the circuit voltage is to_____.?
quizlist.option1: check the voltage supply from the power source
quizlist.option2: set the meter to the lowest range

quizlist.question: In an impressed current cathodic protection system, the anode is_______ .?
quizlist.option1: insulated from the hull and does not waste away.
quizlist.option2: connected to the hull and deteriorates with time
quizlist.option3: connected to the hull but does not waste away

quizlist.question: In order to protect the generator in service from overload, the non-essential load is isolated from the system by this device.?
quizlist.option1: Preferential tripping system
quizlist.option2: stripping system

quizlist.question: The division of kilowatt load between two paralleled alternators is determined by the______ .?
quizlist.option1: load-speed characteristics of the governors
quizlist.option2: low-speed characteristics of the governors

quizlist.question: The standard procedure for maintaining the charge in an emergency diesel starting battery is to trickle charge the battery ________.?
quizlist.option1: Continuously
quizlist.option2: Before

quizlist.question: Normally, the FIRST step in troubleshooting a transistor circuit card is to _______________.?
quizlist.option1: Give the circuit an initial test with a signal generator
quizlist.option2: Give the circuit an pre-test with a signal generator
quizlist.option3: Give the circuit an final test with a signal generator

quizlist.question: When testing a capacitor with an analog type ohmmeter, a good capacitor will be indicated by________.?
quizlist.option1: the meter deflects to a low resistance value and slowly increases towards infinity
quizlist.option2: the meter deflects to a low resistance value and increases rapidly to a higher value, but stays fairly low

quizlist.question: Controller contacts should be routinely cleaned by______.?
quizlist.option1: wiping with a clean dry cloth
quizlist.option2: blowing with compressed air

quizlist.question: The charging of lead-acid storage batteries will always result in_________.?
quizlist.option1: a dangerously explosive gas being liberated
quizlist.option2: dangerous acid burns

quizlist.question: When soldering a printed circuit board component, you should be careful to prevent damage by ____________.?
quizlist.option1: Using the soldering iron tip sparingly
quizlist.option2: Using the soldering iron tip continuosly
quizlist.option3: Using the soldering iron tip precisely

quizlist.question: What precaution should be taken with a vessel's impressed current cathodic protection system after a drydocking period during which the hull has been painted?
quizlist.option1: The unit should remain off for the specified amount of time so as not to disturb curing.
quizlist.option2: A slight (10-15%) overcurrent to the anodes should be allowed in order to speed drying.
quizlist.option3: Output currents should be carefully monitored to assure  operation at nearly 100 % capacity for proper curing

quizlist.question: Electrically operated safety devices on auxiliary diesel engines functions to stop the engine by _________.?
quizlist.option1: shutting off fuel supply
quizlist.option2: shutting off lube oil supply

quizlist.question: As a general rule, the first troubleshooting action to be taken in checking faulty electric control devices is to______ .?
quizlist.option1: test all fuses and measure the line voltage
quizlist.option2: draw a one line diagram of the circuitry

quizlist.question: The electrolyte in a lead-acid storage battery consists of distilled water and ___________?
quizlist.option1: sulfuric acid
quizlist.option2: hydrogen chloride

quizlist.question: Complete maintenance of electrical motors should include checks for machine's ______________.?
quizlist.option1: vibration
quizlist.option2: leaking

quizlist.question: Most three-phase induction motors of five (5) horsepower or less, are started by_______.?
quizlist.option1: across-the-line starters
quizlist.option2: before the line starters

quizlist.question: During troubleshooting a magnetic controller, it is found that the contacts are welded together, what is the most probable cause?
quizlist.option1: Low voltage on the operating coil
quizlist.option2: high voltage on the operating coil
quizlist.option3: short voltage on the operating coil

quizlist.question: Heat sinks are frequently used with____ .?
quizlist.option1: power transistors
quizlist.option2: vacuum tubes

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting electronic equipment, you should use a high impedance multimeter ________.?
quizlist.option1: so as not to load down the circuit and obtain erroneous voltage readings
quizlist.option2: to prevent excess current flow through the meter that would damage it
quizlist.option3: for AC measurements only and a low resistance meter for DC measurements

quizlist.question: Heat sinks are frequently used with____ .?
quizlist.option1: power transistors
quizlist.option2: vacuum tubes

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting a lead-acid storage battery, a weak or dead cell is best detected by ____________?
quizlist.option1: measuring and comparing all cells specific gravity
quizlist.option2: measuring and testing all cells specific gravity
quizlist.option3: testing and comparing all cells specific gravity

quizlist.question: In order to check the performance of a transistor removed from its circuit, the instrument to be used should be a/an_____.?
quizlist.option1: ohmmeter or transistor tester
quizlist.option2: voltmeter or transistor tester

quizlist.question: The mica used in the commutators of DC machinery is _____________.?
quizlist.option1: Harder than copper
quizlist.option2: Harder than titanium

quizlist.question: When supplying emergency lighting loads, the storage battery initial voltage must exceed the standard system voltage by more that_______.?
To repair small electrical motor that has been submerged in saltwater , you should________.?
quizlist.option1: Wash it fresh water and apply external heat
quizlist.option2: Wash it sea water and apply external heat
quizlist.option3: Wash it sea water and apply internal heat

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting electronic equipment, the first step to be taken before testing the circuit voltage is to_____.?
quizlist.option1: check the voltage supply from the power source
quizlist.option2: set the meter to the lowest range

quizlist.question: The electrolyte in a lead-acid storage battery consists of distilled water and ___________?
quizlist.option1: sulfuric acid
quizlist.option2: hydrogen chloride

quizlist.question: Signal injection/trading is a method commonly used in troubleshooting ______.?
quizlist.option1: A radio
quizlist.option2: A VHF

quizlist.question: In order to check the performance of a transistor removed from its circuit, the instrument to be used should be a/an_____.?
quizlist.option1: ohmmeter or transistor tester
quizlist.option2: voltmeter or transistor tester

quizlist.question: What kind of maintenance system replaces a heavily wornout impeller during its operation?
quizlist.option1: Breakdown
quizlist.option2: PMS

quizlist.question: After each overhaul of electric motors, it shall be started at _______________.?
quizlist.option1: No load
quizlist.option2: overload

quizlist.question: What is the best procedure for locating grounded circuit if the light on main electrical switchboard is indicating a ground?
quizlist.option1: Open the circuit breaker on the distribution panel, one at a time, until the light no longer indicate a ground
quizlist.option2: short the circuit breaker on the distribution panel, one at a time, until the light no longer indicate a ground
quizlist.option3: trip off the circuit breaker on the distribution panel, one at a time, until the light no longer indicate a ground

quizlist.question: What is the maintenance system which checks if equipment, engines motors are overhauled as per schedule?
quizlist.option1: Planned
quizlist.option2: weekly

quizlist.question: To determine if a stator coil is grounded, you should use a/an _______.?
quizlist.option1: megger
quizlist.option2: ammeter

quizlist.question: During troubleshooting a magnetic controller, it is found that the contacts are welded together the most probable cause is______.?
quizlist.option1: Low voltage on the operating coil
quizlist.option2: high voltage on the operating coil
quizlist.option3: short voltage on the operating coil

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting most electronic circuits, 'loading effect' can be minimized by using a voltmeter with a/an________?
quizlist.option1: input impedance much greater than the impedance across which the voltage is being measured
quizlist.option2: input impedance much less than the impedance across   which the voltage is being measured

quizlist.question: The charging of lead-acid storage batteries will always result in_________.?
quizlist.option1: a dangerously explosive gas being liberated
quizlist.option2: dangerous acid burns

quizlist.question: Why is it a poor practice to use a high wattage soldering iron when soldering or desoldering components on a printed circuit board?
quizlist.option1: The foil wire bonded to the board may come loosened from the board
quizlist.option2: The circuit board will blister and warp.
quizlist.option3: The circuit board has a low melting temperature.

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting an electronic circuit, a cold solder joint can be located with the aid of an ohmmeter. Once the problem has been located, you should______.?
quizlist.option1: reheat connection with a soldering tool and recheck with an ohmmeter
quizlist.option2: do nothing as this is the normal condition
quizlist.option3: reheat the circuit in an oven to an even temperature and recheck with an ohmmeter

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting most electronic circuits, 'loadingeffect' can be minimized by using a voltmeter with a/an________?
quizlist.option1: input impedance much greater than the impedance across which the voltage is being measured
quizlist.option2: input impedance much less than the impedance across   which the voltage is being measured

quizlist.question: When trouble shooting motor controllers, a shorted relay or contactor coil is often indicated by_______.?
quizlist.option1: Charged insulation and or a blown control fuse
quizlist.option2: disCharged insulation and or a blown control fuse
quizlist.option3: OverCharged insulation and or a blown control fuse

quizlist.question: Which of the damages listed below can occur to the components of a winch motor?
quizlist.option1: rapid corrosion of switch components
quizlist.option2: unrapid corrosion of switch components
quizlist.option3: fast rapid corrosion of switch components

quizlist.question: When testing for blown fuses in a three-phase supply circuit to a motor, you should first _____________.?
quizlist.option1: de-energize the circuit and then use a continuity tester
quizlist.option2: over-energize the circuit and then use a continuity tester
quizlist.option3: short-energize the circuit and then use a continuity tester

quizlist.question: The purpose of DC generator brushes is to____________.?
quizlist.option1: Conduct electric current to an outside circuit
quizlist.option2: Conduct electric current to an open circuit
quizlist.option3: Conduct electric current to an short circuit

quizlist.question: If all of the ground detection lamps burn with equal brilliance whether the test button is depressed or release then __________.?
quizlist.option1: No grounds exist
quizlist.option2: With grounds exist

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting AC motors, portable growler can be used for locating ____________.?
quizlist.option1: Shorted stator coils
quizlist.option2: long stator coils

quizlist.question: When you are troubleshooting a DC motor that fails to start, the first thing to check is the ______.?
quizlist.option1: Fuses and circuit breaker
quizlist.option2: Ballast and circuit breaker

quizlist.question: To check the three lines fuses of a three phase system consisting of a threephase motor, you must___.?
quizlist.option1: Place the starter in the “stop” position
quizlist.option2: Place the starter in the “on” position
quizlist.option3: Place the starter in the “off” position

quizlist.question: While troubleshooting a circuit in an engine room central control console, a resistor is suspected of being faulty Which of the following precautions must be observed if an ohmmeter is to be used to check its value.?
quizlist.option1: Resistor's circuit must be de-energized and at least one end of the component isolated.
quizlist.option2: Correct polarity must be observed because reverse bias will damage the component.
quizlist.option3: Meter leads must not be twisted so as to cancel out the  individual magnetic fields.

quizlist.question: What kind of maintenance system repairs a cargo winch motor due to unusual sound of bearing during loading or unloading of cargo?
quizlist.option1: Condition
quizlist.option2: PMS

quizlist.question: The purpose of a main switchboard circuit breaker reverse power trips is to ________.?
quizlist.option1: Prevent alternator motorization
quizlist.option2: Dont Prevent alternator motorization

quizlist.question: Before reassembling any electrical equipment, you should _______________.?
quizlist.option1: Clean any corroded surfaces
quizlist.option2: dont Clean any corroded surfaces

quizlist.question: Before testing insulation with a megohmmeter, the winding of large machines should be grounded for about 15 minutes just prior to the test because the _____________.?
quizlist.option1: Static charge of the machine may give a false reading
quizlist.option2: Rotary charge of the machine may give a false reading
quizlist.option3: Static charge of the machine may give a True reading

quizlist.question: Third color band on a resistor is used to indicate the_______.?
quizlist.option1: number of zeros following the first two significant figures in the resistance value
quizlist.option2: tolerance of the resistor
quizlist.option3: first significant figure of the resistance

quizlist.question: Commutators and brushes are used on DC generators to _____________.?
quizlist.option1: Convert the induced sine-wave to DC output
quizlist.option2: Convert the induced cosine-wave to DC output
quizlist.option3: Convert the induced sine-wave to AC output

quizlist.question: Sparking of DC motor brushes can be caused by _____________.?
quizlist.option1: Series-wound
quizlist.option2: Parallel-wound

quizlist.question: Which of the listed items will stop a motor due to a reduction in voltage and restart it when the voltage is restored to normal?
quizlist.option1: Low voltage release circuit
quizlist.option2: High voltage release circuit

quizlist.question: A molded-case breaker provides protection against short circuits by using a/an_______.?
quizlist.option1: electromagnet
quizlist.option2: shading coil

quizlist.question: What is the general rule in troubleshooting electrical system fault?
quizlist.option1: make sure to test all fuses and measure the line voltage
quizlist.option2: make sure not to test all fuses and measure the line voltage
quizlist.option3: make sure to secure all fuses and measure the line voltage

quizlist.question: As a general rule, the first troubleshooting action to be taken in checking faulty electric control devices is to______ .?
quizlist.option1: test all fuses and measure the line voltage
quizlist.option2: test all ballast and measure the line voltage
quizlist.option3: test all fuses and ballast the line voltage

quizlist.question: Which procedures should be carried out to prevent moisture damage into an electrical apparatus during extended periods of idleness??
quizlist.option1: Place heat lamps in motor housing
quizlist.option2: Place no lamps in motor housing
quizlist.option3: Place pre-heat lamps in motor housing

quizlist.question: Which of the listed items will stop a motor due to a reduction in voltage and restart it when the voltage is restored to normal?
quizlist.option1: Low voltage release circuit
quizlist.option2: High voltage release circuit

quizlist.question: A solid-state circuit is inoperative; the first action that should be taken is to_______.?
quizlist.option1: check the DC supply voltage
quizlist.option2: check the DC and AC supply voltage

quizlist.question: To determine if a stator coil is grounded, you should use a/an _______.?
quizlist.option1: megger
quizlist.option2: ammeter

quizlist.question: One method of testing for a reversed shunt field coil in a DC generator of motor is by connecting the field to a direct current source at reduced field rated voltage and test for polarity using a/an ______________.?
quizlist.option1: Magnetic compass placed near each field
quizlist.option2: Magnetic compass placed away each field
quizlist.option3: Magnetic compass placed before each field
